rubric.purpose: Evaluates content accessibility for diverse learners including those with disabilities, different learning styles, and varying technical capabilities.

criteria.criterion: Content completely inaccessible to screen readers
Critical information only in images without alt text
Color as only means of conveying information
Content that excludes major learner populations

examples.example: Math only as images with no LaTeX/text
Instructions relying solely on color coding
Video content with no captions or transcripts

criteria.criterion: Missing alt text for complex diagrams
Limited accommodation for different learning styles
Reading level significantly above 8th grade target (10th grade or higher)

examples.example: Issue: Reading level is 11.09 Impact: Content inaccessible to target audience of struggling students Fix: Simplify vocabulary and sentence construction to bring this down to within desired 8-10th grade level range

Issue: Can "its" be replaced with f(x)'s in the following sentence? The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus, Part 2 connects the definite integral of f(x) with the values of its antiderivative at the endpoints Impact: Pronoun "its" may be ambiguous; explicit reference clearer for struggling students Fix: Replace "its" with "f(x)'s": ...with the values of f(x)'s antiderivative at the endpoints

Issue: To what is "it" referring in the following sentence? We need to double it because f is even Impact: Unclear pronoun reference forces students to backtrack and re-read Fix: Replace "it" for clarity

diagnostic_questions.question: Can content be accessed via screen reader?
Are visual elements described in text?
Is color used appropriately (not as sole indicator)?
Is text readable (font size, contrast, spacing)?
Are multiple learning modalities supported?
Is navigation clear and consistent?
Are technical requirements reasonable?
Is language clear for non-native speakers?

good_practices.practice: Alt text for all images and diagrams

failure_modes.failure: Images of text instead of actual text
Dense walls of text without breaks

cross_competency_interactions.interaction: Math must be accessible via proper LaTeX markup
